author: ralexstokes
content:
reposting action items:

Action items

* Pectra timelines
    * Mainnet date confirmed to be May 7 2025
    * Client releases by April 21 2025
    * Pectra mainnet blog post by April 23 2025
* PeerDAS implementations should focus on the cell proof computation migration, and getBlobs support
    * validator custody is another outstanding feature but can be rolled out later so focus should be on the prior features
* FYI: EIP-7892 (BPO scaling) has been CFI’d for Fusaka
* Review the set of PFI’d Fusaka EIPs so we can make a final call on Fusaka CFI’d EIPs on ACDC #155.

author: ralexstokes
content:
there are two threads here: (1) the governance process of PFI -> CFI -> SFI, and (2) the technical merits of EIP-7917 itself.

i'll let the EIP authors of 7917 speak to (2).

regarding (1):

i was biasing towards getting to a final CFI set on this call so that we can keep ACD momentum high (cf. April 10 deadline), and in this view i would lean towards CFI'ing something if there is _some_ chance it could go in the fork as that signals we are serious enough about the EIP to start investigating in-depth (cf. the vetting process you are calling out)

an important distinction here is the difference b/t CFI and SFI -- SFI means it is _definitely_ going into the fork, CFI only indicates it _may_.  i'm not sure how clear this distinction is so i pinged Tim to take some time next week to review. i think Tim had a good model for how it should work on the call. i was also likely confusing the conversation with a misuse of CFI vs SFI terminology on the call and i do apologize for that.

given this, and the points raised (rightfully so!) around being careful with inclusion from yourself, <@755590043632140352>, and <@308223150725005322>, we should take another ACDC to discuss the CFI set for Fusaka
